decisions.question: Q1
decisions.title: Execution Model: Config Deployer vs Runtime Orchestrator vs Hybrid
decisions.rationale: Combines upfront configuration (project-specific tailoring from Config Deployer pattern) with runtime orchestration (continuous control from Runtime Orchestrator pattern). Orchestrator implemented as Claude Code agent, not external process. Maintains President's 'know every wire' principle while providing flexibility to invoke/dismiss orchestrator as needed.
binding_constraints: D2 (Enforcement Mechanism depends on execution model)
D4 (State Tracking depends on agent model)

architectural_pattern.layer_1_static: Deploy agents, skills, hooks, MCP config upfront
architectural_pattern.layer_2_runtime: Orchestrator agent (BMad Master) invokable during session
architectural_pattern.process_model: Orchestrator is Claude Code agent, NOT external process
architectural_pattern.control_model: User can invoke/dismiss orchestrator as needed

trade_off_resolution.simplicity: Medium - upfront config reduces runtime complexity
trade_off_resolution.control: Flexible - runtime control via agent invocation
trade_off_resolution.context: Configurable - layers can be tuned per project
trade_off_resolution.debugging: Medium - persistent agent layer aids visibility
trade_off_resolution.claude_code_native: Balanced - leverages Claude Code's native agent model
